720045f-a.title: Manhattan: Gramercy Park North - Gramercy Park (East)
720045f-a.text:
Gramercy Park North (East 21st Street), west from Gramercy Park East, showing construction work in progress on the Hotel Gramercy Park, at the N.W. corner of Lexington Ave. The low houses in the foreground are Nos. 137 to 127 (right to left) and were later demolished. On their site was erected a 16-story and a 14-story apartment houses bearing Nos. 44 and 45 Gramercy Park North. On the left appears part of the Rex Cole Building, at the S.E. corner of Fourth Ave., and East 21st Street.
April 1925.
Brown Brothers.
720045f-a.folder: Gramercy Park North & Gramercy Park (East), Manhattan, NY

720044f-a.title: Manhattan: Gramercy Park North - Gramercy Park (East)
720044f-a.text:
(1)
Gramercy Park North (foreground, right) at the S.W. corner of Gramercy Park East (left), looking southwestward across Gramercy Park and showing the Parkside, a 17-story residential hotel at the S.W.
corner of Gramercy Park South and lIrving Place.
October 12, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date.
July 7, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
720044f-a.folder: Gramercy Park North & Gramercy Park (East), Manhattan, NY
